Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 13

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 13

Enhance your vocabulary with these important intermediate words commonly used in professional and academic contexts.

Navigation

This is page 13 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Object

/ˈɑːbdʒɪkt/

noun, verb

A material thing that can be seen and touched; to express disagreement.

"The museum displayed ancient objects from different civilizations."

Synonyms: item, thing, article

Category: Thing

Opportunity

/ˌɑːpərˈtuːnəti/

noun

A set of circumstances that makes it possible to do something.

"This job offers a great opportunity for professional growth."

Synonyms: chance, possibility, opening

Category: Chance

Organization

/ˌɔːrɡənəˈzeɪʃən/

noun

An organized group of people with a particular purpose.

"She volunteers for a charitable organization that helps homeless people."

Synonyms: institution, association, company

Category: Group

Original

/əˈrɪdʒənəl/

adjective, noun

Present or existing from the beginning; the earliest form of something.

"The original painting is displayed in the national gallery."

Synonyms: initial, first, authentic

Category: Beginning

Pattern

/ˈpætərn/

noun

A repeated decorative design; a regular and intelligible form or sequence.

"Scientists study weather patterns to predict future conditions."

Synonyms: design, arrangement, sequence

Category: Design

Performance

/pərˈfɔːrməns/

noun

The action or process of carrying out or accomplishing an action, task, or function.

"Her performance in the play received excellent reviews."

Synonyms: execution, presentation, achievement

Category: Achievement

Period

/ˈpɪriəd/

noun

A length or portion of time; a punctuation mark used at the end of sentences.

"The Renaissance was an important period in European history."

Synonyms: time, duration, span

Category: Time

Personal

/ˈpɜːrsənəl/

adjective

Belonging to or affecting a particular person rather than anyone else.

"Please keep your personal belongings with you at all times."

Synonyms: private, individual, own

Category: Individual

Physical

/ˈfɪzɪkəl/

adjective

Relating to the body as opposed to the mind; relating to things perceived through the senses.

"Regular physical exercise is important for maintaining good health."

Synonyms: bodily, corporeal, material

Category: Body

Policy

/ˈpɑːləsi/

noun

A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by a government, party, business, or individual.

"The company has a strict policy against discrimination."

Synonyms: rule, guideline, strategy

Category: Rule

Popular

/ˈpɑːpjələr/

adjective

Liked, admired, or enjoyed by many people or by a particular person or group.

"That restaurant is very popular among college students."

Synonyms: well-liked, favored, trendy

Category: Preference

Position

/pəˈzɪʃən/

noun, verb

A place where someone or something is located or has been put.

"She applied for a position as a marketing manager."

Synonyms: location, place, job

Category: Location
